episodeTitle: The General Zombies Are Down In A Flash!! Oars Feels Like An Adventure!!
description: Usopp's natural negativity proves to be the perfect counter against Perona's ghost attacks. Brook faces defeat against the legendary samurai zombie Ryuma before Zoro arrives to challenge him for his black blade Shusui. Meanwhile, the massive zombie Oars wreaks havoc across Thriller Bark, effortlessly crushing the General Zombies while Sanji races to rescue Nami from her forced wedding.

events.title: Usopp Continues Fight Against Perona's Zombies
events.description: Usopp battles the Wild Zombies and animal zombies under Perona's command while she continues her assault with Negative Hollows. The zombies are surprised that the ghosts aren't affecting Usopp.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's unique immunity to Perona's most powerful ability, setting up his eventual victory.

quotes.text: No one can match me when it comes to being pessimistic!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp explains why Perona's negative ghosts don't work on him

events.title: Perona's Quadruple Negative Attack
events.description: Perona, fearing her potential defeat, summons four Negative Hollows simultaneously in a Quadruple Negative Attack, determined to break Usopp's will to fight.
events.significance: First appearance of Perona's enhanced negative attack technique, though it proves ineffective against Usopp's natural negativity.

events.title: Usopp's Negativity Affects the Ghosts
events.description: The Negative Hollows become dispirited themselves after passing through Usopp. His overwhelming natural negativity is so powerful that it affects the ghosts, making him completely immune to their depressing effects. Even Perona herself is affected when she tries to attack him.
events.significance: Establishes Usopp as Perona's natural enemy and the only Straw Hat who can defeat her, turning his character flaw into a strength.

quotes.text: He's more negative than the negative ghost!
quotes.speaker: Animal Zombie
quotes.context: The zombies realize Usopp's unique immunity

events.title: Brook vs Ryuma Continues
events.description: Brook continues his intense duel with the zombie samurai Ryuma, who possesses Brook's own shadow. They exchange sword techniques, with Ryuma using Brook's signature moves against him.
events.significance: Brook faces his own fighting style reflected back at him, creating a unique mirror match that tests both his skills and resolve.

events.title: Ryuma Uses Three-Verse Humming: Arrow Notch Slash
events.description: Ryuma prepares to finish Brook with the Hanauta Sancho: Yahazu Giri (Three-Verse Humming: Arrow Notch Slash). Brook protests angrily that Ryuma shouldn't use that name since the attack was named by his old comrades from the Rumbar Pirates.
events.significance: Deeply personal moment for Brook as his own techniques and memories are used against him by the zombie possessing his shadow.

quotes.text: You shouldn't use that name! That attack was named by my old comrades!
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's emotional protest against Ryuma using his signature technique

events.title: Brook Defeated by Ryuma
events.description: The two swordsmen walk past one another with invisible slashes, and Ryuma's Arrow Notch Slash prevails. Brook is defeated and collapses, thinking of his time with Laboon and wishing he could apologize to the whale for his bad luck and lonely life.
events.significance: Brook's defeat at the hands of a zombie using his own shadow and techniques represents a low point, but also strengthens his resolve to reclaim what was stolen.

quotes.text: Laboon... I'm sorry for my bad luck and how lonely my life has been...
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook's thoughts as he falls in defeat

events.title: Zoro and Franky Arrive to Save Brook
events.description: Just as Ryuma prepares to permanently destroy Brook by cutting off his afro (which would prevent his shadow from returning), Zoro and Franky arrive. The timely interruption from Oars shaking the mansion gives them the opportunity to save Brook from defeat.
events.significance: Zoro's arrival sets up the epic confrontation between him and the legendary samurai Ryuma, leading to Zoro obtaining Shusui.

events.title: Shusui Revealed - The Legendary Black Blade
events.description: Zoro asks Ryuma if he is the legendary samurai who slayed a dragon long ago. Ryuma confirms and reveals his sword: one of the 21 legendary swords of the highest grade, a famed black blade with a reverse-waved temper line known as Shusui (Autumn Water). Zoro immediately declares he will beat Ryuma and take the sword.
events.significance: Introduction of Shusui, one of the legendary black blades and a national treasure of Wano Country. This moment foreshadows Zoro's connection to Wano and sets up major plot developments in future arcs.

quotes.text: One of the 21 legendary swords of the highest grade. A famed black blade with a reverse-waved temper line. It's known as the Clear Autumn Wind, Shusui.
quotes.speaker: Ryuma

quotes.text: That settles it. I'm gonna beat you and take that sword as my own.
quotes.speaker: Zoro

events.title: Zoro Challenges Ryuma
events.description: Zoro declares he will recover Brook's shadow for him and challenges the legendary samurai zombie to combat. Ryuma is initially angry about the outside interference but accepts Zoro's challenge after recognizing him as a worthy opponent.
events.significance: Begins one of Zoro's most significant battles in the series, facing a legendary samurai and gaining one of his iconic swords.

quotes.text: I'll recover your shadow for you, Brook.
quotes.speaker: Zoro

events.title: Oars Plays with Thriller Bark's Rudder
events.description: The massive zombie Oars treats Thriller Bark like a toy, playing with the ship's rudder and trying to speed up the vessel. His childlike behavior with Luffy's personality causes the entire island-ship to shake and enter dangerous ocean currents.
events.significance: Demonstrates Oars' destructive power combined with Luffy's playful personality, creating chaos that affects multiple battle situations across Thriller Bark.

events.title: Absalom Orders General Zombies to Stop Oars
events.description: Absalom, frustrated by Oars' interference with his wedding plans, orders all the General Zombies attending the ceremony to leave the chapel and stop the rampaging giant from destroying Thriller Bark.
events.significance: Sets up the General Zombies' devastating defeat and demonstrates the hierarchy of zombie power on Thriller Bark.

events.title: Oars Crushes All General Zombies
events.description: The General Zombies attempt to stop Oars, but he suddenly disappears from their sight. He reappears directly above them, dropping down and crushing them all simultaneously while mimicking Luffy's Gomu Gomu no Gatling technique (though without actually stretching). All the General Zombies are instantly defeated.
events.significance: Demonstrates Oars' overwhelming power even without Devil Fruit abilities, using only his size, strength, and Luffy's fighting instincts. Shows that Oars is a threat beyond normal zombie forces.

quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: Oars' demand to the defeated General Zombies

events.title: Absalom's Horror at Oars' Power
events.description: A zombie reports to Absalom that all the General Zombies who just left the chapel have been defeated. Absalom is horrified by how quickly they were beaten and worries that Oars might sink the entire island-ship if he continues rampaging.
events.significance: Emphasizes the threat Oars poses even to Thriller Bark itself and creates urgency for stopping him.

events.title: Sanji Arrives at the Wedding Chapel
events.description: Just as Absalom worries about Oars sinking the island, Sanji bursts into the chapel declaring he has come to take Nami back. He confronts Absalom over the forced wedding ceremony.
events.significance: Sanji's arrival initiates the rescue of Nami and sets up the upcoming battle between Sanji and Absalom.

quotes.text: Nami! I've come to take you back!
quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji's declaration upon arriving at the chapel

events.title: Luffy Senses Oars' Rampage
events.description: In his confrontation with Gecko Moria, Luffy senses the shaking caused by Oars. Moria blames Luffy for the chaos, while Luffy shows his determination to defeat Moria and recover the shadows of his crew and Brook.
events.significance: Maintains the parallel storylines of Luffy vs Moria and Oars' rampage, connecting the main conflict threads.

quotes.text: I'll get back the shadows of my crew and Brook by defeating you!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: No one can match me when it comes to being pessimistic!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Explaining his immunity to Perona's negative ghosts

quotes.text: One of the 21 legendary swords of the highest grade. A famed black blade with a reverse-waved temper line. It's known as the Clear Autumn Wind, Shusui.
quotes.speaker: Ryuma
quotes.context: Introducing his legendary black blade to Zoro

quotes.text: That settles it. I'm gonna beat you and take that sword as my own.
quotes.speaker: Zoro
quotes.context: Declaring his intention to claim Shusui

quotes.speaker: Oars
quotes.context: After crushing all the General Zombies

quotes.text: Nami! I've come to take you back!
quotes.speaker: Sanji

themes.description: Usopp's overwhelming negativity, typically portrayed as a character flaw, becomes his greatest strength against Perona. His ability to turn his weakness into an advantage demonstrates that every trait has situational value.
themes.symbolism: The negative ghosts being affected by Usopp symbolizes how extreme pessimism can paradoxically become a form of mental immunity.

themes.description: The introduction of Shusui and Ryuma's legendary status explores themes of inherited legacy, with Zoro seeking to claim a blade that connects to Wano Country's history and his own unknown heritage.
themes.symbolism: The black blade represents the weight of history and the mastery required to create legendary weapons.

themes.description: Brook confronts a zombie using his own shadow, techniques, and memories against him. The violation of having one's identity stolen and weaponized creates deep emotional resonance.
themes.symbolism: Ryuma using Brook's named techniques represents the ultimate form of identity theft.

themes.description: Oars combines immense destructive power with Luffy's childlike personality, creating chaos through playful actions without malicious intent.
themes.symbolism: Oars treating the rudder like a toy represents innocence combined with catastrophic consequences.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp's natural negativity proves to be the perfect counter to Perona's abilities, giving him a rare moment to shine as the only Straw Hat who can defeat one of Moria's commanders.
keyActions: Withstands Perona's Negative Hollows without effect
Turns the ghosts' power back on themselves
quotes: No one can match me when it comes to being pessimistic!

characterSpotlights.development: Zoro encounters the legendary samurai Ryuma and the black blade Shusui, setting up a confrontation that will test his skills and connect him to Wano Country's history.
keyActions: Recognizes Ryuma as the dragon-slaying samurai
Declares his intention to claim Shusui
quotes: That settles it. I'm gonna beat you and take that sword as my own.

characterSpotlights.development: Brook experiences the pain of fighting his own shadow and techniques, ultimately being defeated. This low point strengthens his resolve to reclaim what was stolen.
keyActions: Protests Ryuma using his named attacks
Is rescued by Zoro and Franky
quotes: You shouldn't use that name! That attack was named by my old comrades!

characterSpotlights.development: Oars demonstrates the dangerous combination of massive power with Luffy's playful personality, creating widespread chaos across Thriller Bark.
keyActions: Mimics Luffy's Gatling technique without stretching

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends several scenes including Usopp's interaction with the animal zombies and the confrontation between Brook and Ryuma for additional dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: Ryuma's voice actor Chō is the same as Brook's because the zombie contains Brook's shadow. Similarly, Oars shares Luffy's voice actor Mayumi Tanaka in Japanese (Colleen Clinkenbeard in English) because Oars has Luffy's shadow.
This episode adapts Chapter 462 (pages 2-19) and Chapter 463 (pages 2-3) of the manga.
Shusui is one of only two confirmed black blades in the series at this point, the other being Mihawk's Yoru. Black blades are incredibly rare and are created through a swordsman's mastery of Haki.
The quadruple negative attack (Yonbai no Negative Kogeki) debuts in this episode as Perona's enhanced technique.
The episode's Japanese title uses 'General' in katakana (ジェネラル, Jeneraru) before Zombie, emphasizing the rank of the zombies Oars defeats.
